member.name: T:SharpRaven.Data.BreadcrumbLevel
member.summary: This defines the level of the event. If not provided it defaults to info which is the middle level. In the order of priority from highest to lowest the levels are critical, error, warning, info and debug. Levels are used in the UI to emphasize and deemphasize the crumb.

member.name: T:SharpRaven.Data.BreadcrumbType
member.summary: Indicates the descriptions of individual breadcrumb types, and what their data properties look like.

member.name: F:SharpRaven.Data.BreadcrumbType.Navigation
member.summary: Describes a navigation breadcrumb. A navigation event can be a URL change in a web application, or a UI transition in a mobile or desktop application, etc. Its data property has the following sub-properties: from A string representing the original application state / location. to A string representing the new application state / location.

member.name: F:SharpRaven.Data.BreadcrumbType.Http
member.summary:
Describes an HTTP request breadcrumb. This represents an HTTP request transmitted from your application. This could be an AJAX request from a web application, or a server-to-server HTTP request to an API service provider, etc.
Its data property has the following sub-properties:
url The request URL. method The HTTP request method. status_code The HTTP status code of the response. reason A text that describes the status code.

member.name: T:SharpRaven.Data.Breadcrumb
member.summary: Breadcrumb trail.

member.returns: true if the conversion succeeds; otherwise false.

member.name: T:SharpRaven.Data.ErrorLevel
member.summary: Indicates the severity of the error.

member.name: F:SharpRaven.Data.ErrorLevel.Fatal
member.summary: The error is fatal and more severe than a captured exception or regular . Errors at this severity will show up as dark red in the Sentry Stream.

member.name: F:SharpRaven.Data.ErrorLevel.Error
member.summary: The error is of the same severity as a captured exception. Errors at this severity will show up as bright red in the Sentry Stream.

member.name: F:SharpRaven.Data.ErrorLevel.Warning
member.summary: The error is less severe than an a regular . Errors at this severity will show up as orange in the Sentry Stream.

member.name: F:SharpRaven.Data.ErrorLevel.Info
member.summary: The error is less severe than a and is probably expected. Errors at this severity will show up as blue in the Sentry Stream.

member.name: F:SharpRaven.Data.ErrorLevel.Debug
member.summary: The error is less even severe than an and is just captured for debug purposes. Errors at this severity will show up as grey in the Sentry Stream.

member.name: T:SharpRaven.Data.ExceptionFrame
member.summary: Represents Sentry's version of .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.
member.returns: A that represents this instance.

member.name: M:SharpRaven.Data.ExceptionFrame.DemangleAsyncFunctionName
member.summary: Clean up function and module names produced from `async` state machine calls.
member.para: When the Microsoft cs.exe compiler compiles some modern C# features, such as async/await calls, it can create synthetic function names that do not match the function names in the original source code. Here we reverse some of these transformations, so that the function and module names that appears in the Sentry UI will match the function and module names in the original source-code.

member.name: M:SharpRaven.Data.ExceptionFrame.DemangleAnonymousFunction
member.summary: Clean up function names for anonymous lambda calls.

member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute path.

member.summary: Gets or sets the filename.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function.

member.name: P:SharpRaven.Data.ExceptionFrame.InApp
member.summary: Signifies whether this frame is related to the execution of the relevant code in this stacktrace. For example, the frames that might power the framework’s webserver of your app are probably not relevant, however calls to the framework’s library once you start handling code likely are.
member.value: true unless the StackFrame is part of the System namespace.

member.returns: True if a valid credit card number; otherwise false.
